intro: Phyllanthus yangambiensis, commonly known as the Yangambi tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Central and West Africa, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It produces a unique fruit that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
